channel.title: Hosting Help
channel.description:
First off, let me say that I'm sorry if this is in the wrong section. I just got my vps set up with java and screen and am having trouble getting it to run. The vps is running on linux (CentOS to be more specific) Anytime I try to run my server using "sh vpsrun.sh" I get this error (I already converted the code to linux and changed the extension from bat to sh)
[code]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: source.source.Srver at gnu.java.lang.MainThread.run(libgcj.so.10) Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: source.source.Srver not found in gnu.gcj.runtime.SystemClassLoader{urls=[file:./], parent=gnu.gcj.runtime.ExtensionClassLoader{urls=[], parent=null}} at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(libgcj.so.10) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(libgcj.so.10) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(libgcj.so.10) at gnu.java.lang.MainThread.run(libgcj.so.10)[/code]

item.title: Hosting Help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“RunePKn00b, post:11, topic:527796”]ok I’m getting a different error this time

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ClassFormatError: server.Server (unrecognized class file version) at java.lang.VMClassLoader.defineClass(libgcj.so.10) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(libgcj.so.10) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(libgcj.so.10) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(libgcj.so.10) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(libgcj.so.10) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(libgcj.so.10) at gnu.java.lang.MainThread.run(libgcj.so.10) [/quote]
Compile with a lower version of java, or get newer java.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @RunePKn00b RunePKn00b
item.description:
@RunePKn00b wrote:

ok I’m getting a different error this time

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ClassFormatError: server.Server (unrecognized class file version) at java.lang.VMClassLoader.defineClass(libgcj.so.10) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(libgcj.so.10) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(libgcj.so.10) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(libgcj.so.10) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(libgcj.so.10) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(libgcj.so.10) at gnu.java.lang.MainThread.run(libgcj.so.10)

item.title: Hosting Help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

What’s with this?:
screen -A -m -d -S source java
Online it says:

screen -d -m yourcommand
So it'd be: screen -m -d java Yes?

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting Help
item.dc:creator: @RunePKn00b RunePKn00b
item.description:
@RunePKn00b wrote:

Here’s my vpsrun.sh code, on the vps the source is located under /home and the folder is called “source” so /home/source and for the Server.class file it’s at /home/source/Data/CompiledFiles/server and then the Server.class is in that.

echo Loading Up Files... screen -A -m -d -S source java -classpath bin:deps/poi.jar:deps/mysql.jar:deps/mina.jar:deps/slf4j.jar:deps/slf4j-nop.jar:deps/jython.jar:log4j-1.2.15.jar Data.CompiledFiles.server.Server

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting Help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

RunePKn00b:

Well it’s kinda too late now…

Yep, so edit your Run.sh file so it finds the path correctly.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @RunePKn00b RunePKn00b

item.title: Hosting Help
item.dc:creator: @RunePKn00b RunePKn00b
item.description:
@RunePKn00b wrote:

I didn’t even know it was CentOS, I found out after I got the information for it. I just figured I’m paying $5, whatever OS I get I’ll work with

Now I’m getting this

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server at gnu.java.lang.MainThread.run(libgcj.so.10) Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: server not found in gnu.gcj.runtime.SystemClassLoader{urls=[file:./], parent=gnu.gcj.runtime.ExtensionClassLoader{urls=[], parent=null}} at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(libgcj.so.10) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(libgcj.so.10) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(libgcj.so.10) at gnu.java.lang.MainThread.run(libgcj.so.10)

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting Help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

RunePKn00b:

could you please just help me? I don’t have the money right now to afford a windows one or gui, I just really want this to be set up because my hoster is away at college and won’t be able to host anymore until he’s back

Then you shouldn’t have bought a CentOS one in the first place, and saved until you got a windows…

Read the error.
It can’t find the main class (Server, or in this case, Srver) in: source/source…

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting Help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Stop being a cheap ass and buy a server with a gui or a windows server…
I’m tired of all the CentOS questions because people don’t know how to run a server on linux command line.

Read full topic
